Description.val:
The Common Defensive Weapon System (CDWS) consists of a GAU-21 .50 caliber Machine Gun, cradle, ammo box, feed/link chutes and a platform specific mount system. For the MV-22 CDWS, which is in production, Ramp Mount Weapon Systems (RMWS) will be procured.  CDWS was procured to replace obsolete GAU-16 and XM-218 .50 caliber Machine Guns. CDWS enhances the warfighters overall capability by providing a safer, more reliable and accurate weapon system with a higher rate of fire.  For the CH-53K, which is in production, procurement of the Ramp, Door and Window mounted CDWS may be procured.

Funding also supports the modification of medium caliber gun systems used on Navy/Marine Aircraft as well as modifications to crew served weapons including the 7.62mm and .50 cal machine guns currently used on Navy/Marine Helicopters. The modifications to Crew Serve Weapon Systems will increase safety and reliability.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 baseline funding will procure 22 modified Ramp Mount Weapon System for the MV-22 aircraft and associated support.

OCO: 
FY 2020 OCO funding will procure 94 GAU-21 machine guns, 108 M240 machine guns and associated support. This procurement is necessary to reset the force and replace weapons whose service life was expended in support of combat operations.

Name.@footnote: Unit cost projections for MV-22 can fluctuate based on other DoD and FMS customers procurement requirements. The total contracted quantity may result in a slightly lower or higher projected unit cost for MV-22 CDWS hardware.
